question: This state emerges as first champion of Khelo India School Games with 38 gold medals.
explanation: Haryana youngsters outclassed others by achieving the highest number of medal tally in the inaugural edition of the Khelo India School Games. The competition concluded in New Delhi. The sports powerhouse won 102 medals including 38 gold medals, 26 silver medals, 38 Bronze medals. Maharashtra (110) finished second overall while Delhi (94) came third. Punjab and Kerala won the boys' and girls' gold medals respectively in Basketball competition. On the final day, Haryana emerged with the best haul of five medals, including one gold, two silver, and two bronze medals. Haryana archers showed impressive performance and won one gold medal on the final day.
